question: [1/20] Which of the following words is a synonym for 'oblivious'? A) Aware B) Forgetful C) Observant D) Intelligent
[2/20] Which of the following sentences is written in the passive voice? A) I ate breakfast this morning. B) The dog chased the cat. C) The book was read by me. D) She is singing a song.
[3/20] What is the correct spelling of the adjective meaning 'having a bad temper'? A) Irrate B) Irate C) Irritae D) Irritat
[4/20] Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct? A) She don't like pizza. B) He don't want to go. C) They don't have any money. D) I don't know what you means.
[5/20] What is the correct form of the verb in the following sentence: 'He _____ his keys on the table.' A) leaves B) leave C) left D) leaved
[6/20] What is the plural form of the noun 'child'? A) Childs B) Childrens C) Childes D) Children
[7/20] Which of the following sentences uses a non-finite verb? A) I am eating lunch. B) He is running in the park. C) She likes to read books. D) I enjoy swimming.
[8/20] What is the correct preposition to use in the following sentence: 'I am going _____ the store.' A) at B) in C) on D) to
[9/20] Which of the following words is an adverb? A) Quickly B) Smart C) Funny D) Tall
[10/20] What is the correct form of the verb in the following sentence: 'She _____ her bike to school every day.' A) rides B) rode C) ridden D) riding

[11/20] Which of the following sentences uses a comma splice? A) I went to the store, but I forgot my wallet. B) I went to the store, but I forgot my wallet. C) He is tall, dark, and handsome. D) I woke up early, I went for a run.

[12/20] Which of the following sentences uses the subjunctive mood correctly? A) If he was taller, he could reach the top shelf. B) If I was you, I would study more. C) I wish he was here. D) If I were rich, I would buy a yacht.
[13/20] Which of the following words is a conjunction? A) after B) green C) big D) forever
[14/20] What is the comparative form of the adjective 'hot'? A) hotter B) more hot C) hottest D) more hotter

[15/20] Which of the following sentences is an example of a conditional sentence? A) She always brings her lunch to work. B) He will go to the store if he has time. C) I am happy when it is sunny outside. D) The dog barked all night.
[16/20] What is the correct form of the verb in the following sentence: 'They _____ soccer every weekend.' A) plays B) played C) playing D) play
[17/20] Which of the following sentences uses a phrasal verb? A) I am going to the store later. B) She always wakes up early. C) He walked slowly to the door. D) I need to look up the definition.
[18/20] What is the correct form of the verb in the following sentence: 'She _____ her car yesterday.' A) wash B) washed C) washing D) has washed
[19/20] Which of the following sentences uses the passive voice? A) The dog chased the cat. B) I am reading a book. C) The cake was baked by my mom. D) He is running in the park.
[20/20] What is the superlative form of the adjective 'funny'? A) most funniest B) more funnier C) funnier D) funniest
